text:
Problem 4.4

Growing Amoebas: Extending the Properties of Exponents

In Problem 4.1 and Problem 4.2 we investigated properties for integer exponents and found the following to be true, where x ≠ 0, y ≠ 0, and m and n are integers.

xmxn = xm+n

(xm)n = xmn

(xy)m = xmym

xm/xn = xm-n

x-1 = 1/x

x0 = 1

Do these properties work for rational exponents?

Did You Know?

Single-cell amoebas are among the simplest organisms. A single-cell amoeba doubles every 4 days. The life cycle of an amoeba is typically only a few days. Most amoebas have no fixed shape and are so small they cannot be seen with the naked eye. Yet there is one species, Gromia sphaerica, that is the size of a grape! Amoebas and humans have many common features. Both have DNA and cellular structure. Amoebas play an important role in agriculture, economics, environment, and health, just to name a few contexts.
